Description: Body sherd (mended from three fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery dinos; interior glazed black; exterior: on shoulder, narrow band in added red above band of alternatine red and white tongues outlined in dilute; below, two bands; below, black-figure decoration consisting of part of rider (red on chest) and bridled horse to right (red on eye and part of neck) with foreleg raised; part of right trace and right pole horse of a frontal chariot (neck and chest of trace horse with eye in red, neck and possibly chest; harness collar decorated with incised wavy line; mane, part of neck in red with collar, top of head of pole horse); part of bearded charioteer’s head, to right (red on face and eye).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.580.d. See Williams, D. 'Sophilos in the British Museum', Greek Vases in the J. Paul Getty Museum I, 1983, 33, for an objection to attribution to the painter himself. G. Bakir, Sophilos. Ein Beitrag zu seinem Stil. Mainz 1981, 66, no. A7, fig. 123.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.14.1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 290, no. B268)
